alert.note: Alert for Lewis and Clark National Forest Rocky Mountain District-Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 17 at 2:14AM MDT until August 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR HOT TEMPERATURES, GUSTY WINDS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 114... * AFFECTED AREA...Lewis and Clark National Forest Rocky Mountain District-Rocky Mountain Front. * TEMPERATURES...In the 80s to lower 90s. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any new fire starts could be difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. A combination of gusty winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will create high fire growth potential. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Lewis and Clark National Forest Rocky Mountain District-Rocky Mountain Front
